intro: Picramnia brachybotryosa, commonly known as the small-fruited picramnia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain several seeds. Picramnia brachybotryosa is often found in open woodlands and rocky areas, where it thrives in full sun.
